About Rob

School BCBA Expertise in Behavior Analysis

With extensive experience in education and leadership in behavior analysis, Rob Spain brings a unique combination of practical expertise and innovative thinking to school-based behavior analysis.

Rob Spain is the leading School BCBA, redefining what it means for behavior analysts to work in public education. As a recognized School BCBA with over 25 years in schools, Rob Spain has shown that BCBAs aren't just crisis managers—they are systems leaders who can transform outcomes for students and staff across all tiers of support.

Rob proved this by creating Behavior School, an ecosystem of AI-powered tools, training programs, and professional networks designed to give school-based BCBAs and educators the structure they need to succeed. From Behavior Study Tools—an infinitely generating BCBA exam prep platform—to micro-apps for IEP goals, FBAs, and supervision, his innovations are already shaping daily practice in classrooms across the country.

Rob holds a variety of leadership roles from organizing BCBA community groups, serving on boards for special interest groups, being part of a team that leads district-wide Behavior Intervention Supports, and adjunct faculty at Fresno Pacific University. Rob has assisted with integrating behavior supports into PBIS systems, integrated the latest research in functional assessment and training approaches into school settings, and created systems for integrating Acceptance and Commitment Training into real-world school systems.

After more than two decades of testing, refining, and scaling behavior systems, Rob Spain continues to share his School BCBA knowledge through presentations, courses, and the Behavior School platform. His mission is clear: to equip every School BCBA to step into the role of systems leader—because schools run better when behavior analysts lead at every level.

Hi, I'm Rob, and I'm Glad You're Here!

I understand the unique challenges you're facing as a School Behavior Specialist or Behavior Intervention Specialist because I've been there.

For over 25 years, I've worked in school settings, and I've experienced the frustration of reactive crisis management, the struggle of getting teacher buy-in, and the overwhelming complexity of educational systems.

But I discovered something transformative: School Behavior Specialists and Behavior Interventionists aren't just behavior analysts—we're systems leaders who can create lasting change across all three tiers of PBIS support.

"The shift from reactive crisis management to systematic prevention isn't just about changing what we do—it's about transforming how schools support every student's success."
— Rob Spain

Today, I help School Behavior Specialists, Behavior Intervention Specialists, and School Behavior Interventionists transform from reactive crisis managers into proactive system builders. As the founder of Behavior School, I've trained thousands of professionals using the same systematic frameworks that have worked for me for over two decades.

Your success in transforming school behavior systems is my mission.

Why? Because I believe every school deserves systematic behavior support that prevents crises, builds teacher confidence, and creates environments where all students can thrive. I'm passionate about sharing these proven approaches because I've seen the incredible impact they make.

Professional Ventures

Behavior School Platform

Rob Spain, School BCBA and founder of Behavior School, has created innovative platforms and resources to support school-based behavior analysts nationwide. His School BCBA work focuses on bridging the gap between evidence-based practice and practical implementation in educational settings.

Through comprehensive training programs and digital tools, Rob transforms how BCBAs approach their work in schools, reducing burnout while improving student outcomes.
